subject: Re: [junit] Re: Help setting up JUnit
msgSnippet: On Wed, 28 Jan 2004 19:42:02 -0000, dinglek2004  ... Don t take this the wrong way, but it doesn t sound like your problem is JUnit
messageBody:
On Wed, 28 Jan 2004 19:42:02 -0000, dinglek2004 <dinglek@...>
wrote:

> Not explicitly, but I did not think that was necessary. There wasn't
> anything about it in the JUnit docs. The file is in the directory
> junit\tests\runner under my base classpath directory, and the
> reference within the call is to junit.tests.runner.LoadedFromJar,
> which is correct from the base classpath. I tried adding it in
> explicitly without success.

Don't take this the wrong way, but it doesn't sound like your problem is
JUnit related. It sounds like you need to brush up on Java classpath &
Java commandline usage. You can look at
http://www.kevinboone.com/classpath.html for more help, or just Google for
'java classpath' and 'java commandline', you will get tons of hits.

--
Jason Rogers

"So great is the ignorance, so very little the knowledge, of even the best
of men!" - John Wesley, "Christian Perfection"
